sen.j: 筒井氏（つついし）は、大和国の戦国大名である。

sen.e: After the end of the Kamakura period, Kofuku-ji Temple served as Shugo (provincial constable) of Yamato Province, and the Tsutsui clan was included in the group of monk-soldiers of the temple, but since the Sengoku period began, Kofuku-ji Temple went into a decline, and local clans such as the Tsutsui and the Ochi began to rise in exchange.

After the Kamakura period, Kofuku-ji Temple served as Shugo (provincial constable) of Yamato Province, and the Tsutsui clan served it as Shuto (group of monk-soldiers of temple); in the Sengoku period, Kofuku-ji Temple went into a decline, and local clans such as the Tsutsui clan and the Ochi clan began to rise in exchange.

sen.j: 1467年の応仁の乱では、河内国の守護大名である畠山氏の抗争に巻き込まれて、大和国内は混乱する。

sen.e: In those days, Junko TSUTSUI, who became the head of the Tsutsui clan, beat and destroyed their foe Ochi clan while remaining as a member of Yamato's local clans on the side of Kofuku-ji Temple, extended their influence, and established the clan as the Sengoku daimyo of Yamato.

Junko TSUTSUI, who became the head of the Tsutsui clan in the chaotic situation, demonstrated his ability very well and destroyed the longtime foe the Ochi clan while serving Kofuku-ji Temple as one of Kokujinshu (local governors) of Yamato, and he extended influence to establish the clan as one of powerful Sengoku daimyo of Yamato.
